article.title: Rescattering effects in the hadronic-light-by-light contribution to the anomalous magnetic moment of the muon

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts contributions to Hadronic Light-by-Light (HLbL) scattering involving two-pion intermediate states. Which of the following statements about the figure is **incorrect**?
choices: Solid lines represent pions and wiggly lines represent photons.
Dashed lines indicate where propagators are being cut.
Diagrams with heavier intermediate states are represented by triple lines.
Crossed diagrams, representing permutations of external photons, are omitted for brevity.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (5) presents a three-dimensional integral representation for the HLbL contribution to the muon anomalous magnetic moment.  What do the  Τ<sub>i</sub> symbols represent in this formula?
choices: They represent suitable linear combinations of the BTT I<sub>i</sub>.
They stand for Euclidean momenta squared.
They indicate the Mandelstam variables s, t, and u.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (9) provides a numerical evaluation of the pion box contribution to the muon anomalous magnetic moment. What is the primary factor contributing to the reduced uncertainty compared to earlier "pion loop" evaluations?
choices: The use of a vector-meson-dominance pion form factor.
The inclusion of both space-like and time-like form factor data.
The unambiguous definition of the pion box in terms of the pion vector form factor.
The utilization of a dispersive representation for analytic continuation.

multiple_choice_question.text: Table II presents the S-wave rescattering corrections to the pion box contribution for different cutoff values. What conclusion can be drawn from the stability of the results across the cutoff range?
choices: The dominant contribution to the rescattering corrections comes from the fo(980) resonance.
The input for the γ*γ* → ππ partial waves effectively unitarizes the Born-term left-hand cut.
The KK channel plays a negligible role in the overall rescattering effects.
Higher partial waves are expected to have a significant impact on the final result.
